instructions: Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 1 1 Open the Settings Image titled Iphonesettingsappicon.png app. Tap the icon that resembles two silver gears to open the Settings menu. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 2 2 Tap . It's next to a grey icon with a single gear. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 3 3 Tap or . This displays how much storage space is being used on your iPhone or iPad and how much space each app is using. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 4 4 Scroll down and tap an app. All apps installed on your iPhone or iPad are listed at the bottom of iPhone/iPad Storage menu. Tap on the app who's data you want to delete. The amount of space an app is using is listed to the right of the app. Look for apps that use the most amount of space that you are not longer using. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 5 5 Tap . It's the red text at the bottom of the info screen. This displays a confirmation pop-up menu asking if you want to delete the app. Alternatively, you can tap Offload App to delete the app and keep documents and data related to the app, in case you want to install it again with your saved information. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 6 6 Tap . It's the red text in the lower-right corner of the confirmation pop-up. This deletes the app an all related documents and data. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 7 7 Reinstall the app from the App Store. This will be a fresh install of the app without all the accumulated documents and data the app may have built up. [1] Advertisement

Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 31 1 Open your devices's Photos app. It's a white app with a multicolored pinwheel icon that you'll likely find on the Home screen. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 32 2 Tap . It's a tab in the bottom-right corner of the screen. If Photos opens to a photo, collection, or memory, first tap the "Back" button in the top left corner of the screen. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 33 3 Tap the "Camera Roll" album. It's the top-left album on this page. This album is where all of your photos are stored. If your phone has iCloud Photo Library enabled, this album will be called "All Photos" instead. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 34 4 Tap . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 35 5 Tap each photo you wish to delete. Each photo you tap will be selected; you'll see a white checkmark on a blue background appear in the bottom-right corner of the photo's thumbnail. If you want to delete every photo on your iPhone, you can quickly select them all rather than tapping each one individually. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 36 6 Tap the trash icon. It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 37 7 Tap . It's a pop-up option at the bottom of the screen. Doing so will remove your selected photos from the "Camera Roll" album (and any other albums they're in) and place them in the "Recently Deleted" album. If you're only deleting one photo, this button will say "Delete Photo" instead. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 38 8 Tap the "Back" button. It's in the top-left corner of the screen. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 39 9 Scroll down and tap . It will be on the right side of the screen. This folder stores all photos and videos that you've deleted in the past 30 days, after which point they are permanently deleted from your iPhone. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 40 10 Tap . This option is in the top-right corner of the screen. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 41 11 Tap . It's in the bottom-left corner of the screen. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 42 12 Tap . It's at the bottom of the screen. Doing so will permanently delete all photos in the "Recently Deleted" folder from your iPhone. If you're only deleting one photo, this button will say "Delete Photo" instead. Advertisement

Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 54 2 Tap . It's in the lower-right corner of the screen. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 55 3 Tap . Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 58 1 Open the Chrome app. It's a white app that contains a multicolored aperture icon. Chrome is Google's browser that you would have had to download from the App Store; it does not ship with your iPhone. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 59 2 Tap . It's in the upper-right corner of the screen. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 60 3 Tap . It's near the bottom of the menu. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 61 4 Tap . It's in the "Advanced" section of the menu. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 62 5 Tap . It's at the bottom of the menu. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 63 6 Tap the types of data you'd like to delete. Tap Browsing History to delete the history of sites you visited. Tap Cookies, Site Data to delete website information stored on your device. Tap Cached Images and Files to delete data stored on your device that allows Chrome to open websites more quickly. Tap Saved Passwords to delete passwords that Chrome has stored on your device. Tap Autofill Data to delete information such as addresses and phone numbers that Chrome uses to automatically fill in Web forms. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 64 7 Tap . It's a red button just below the data types you selected. Image titled Delete Application Data in iOS Step 65 8 Tap . The Chrome data you selected will now be deleted from your device. Advertisement
